topic.title: Do you like John Peel and the Peel Sessions?
topic.body:
If you do, maybe you're interested in hosting some? Here's a list of sessions, that I've taken upon myself to spring out of youtube jail:

http://127.0.0.1:43110/1DA3AYUWNqpwHGHtgTfUXF41JivZHte2af/

It's currently about ~~120~~ **28** gb of optional files. If you want, I guess you could pick the files you like and assist in serving up those.

topic.title: Ransomware attack on US pipeline
topic.body:
[Stupid](https://www.cbsnews.com/news/colonial-pipeline-ransomware-attack-darkside-criminal-gang/)

Indeed, why not expose your countrys' infrastructure to script kiddie ms windows attacks from everywhere in the world. Good job! In a couple of years, most people in the "developed" world will be unable to enter their home or turn on the light because the door and lightbulb were hacked. Imagine a "developed" person, swiping, swiping, swiping and the door just won't open. Time for a surly tweet? Hilarious.

1582649582_13EafRdDw5sZF42dTn68uDdcssTWK.body: So, after the revolution, males can't walk around nude without getting fired? I'm tired of this fucking leaf, I need you normalize my penis. Get on it.

1591525925_14ADWoY886HnM8jPeipXarxAfyQAN.body: Been looking for Rainbow Drive from 1990. In the unlikely event, you have access to that , I'd very much like to see it on IFS.
Thanks! I'll seed it. If I ever manage to download the file.
I continue to let it work. It's probably going to take a while if we're both on tor.
Actually downloading now! Slow af though, currently at 1.1%. So don't stop seeding for the next week or so.

> [musicz](#comment_11_14ADWoY886HnM8jPeipXarxAfyQANiMTQj): i created an additional seed in a second machine. your download work now? i see my two machines seeding the file

Got to 10.66%, no movement for a couple of days. I give up for now - let me know if I should try again for whatever reason.

@musicz FYI, I somehow managed to download rainbow drive yesterday. You could shave a little off the file size if you wanted by removing the last 15 minutes, which is the beginning repeated. Then again, nobody will probably want to watch that movie ever again. Nonetheless, I'll seed for a while.

@musicz Well, I thank you for sharing it. I've been looking for it for many years without luck. 

I've been getting into Tribler recently. Have you tried it? It might be better suited for piracy than ifs over tor.

The bottleneck regarding file sharing on zeronet is tor. Yet anonymity is necessary. I suppose a community could be maintained on zeronet (or wherever) while the filesharing took place somewhere else.

Case in point, here's a link to a tribler channel: 

magnet:?xt=urn:btih:1304988ac2914065191ba385c7f271cb9ba7b976&dn=%28bats%29+Movie

I don't know if the link works. Would appreciate feedback.
@ryuyu5 Be that as it may, the program seems to work, sorta.
@musicz @musicz4 @musicz5 Are you still doing requests? If yes, I'd appreciate (and seed) uploads of Mr. Stitch from 1995 and also Mr. Frost from 1990.

@musicz4 I'm on an Eli Roth kick. For some reason, the torrents are apparently dead for: Hostel Part II (2007), The Last Exorcism (2010) and Clown (2014). Maybe I'm looking the wrong places. If you can provide, I will continue to seed.

1594773031_1AyoVRTzmLdBab5UodAe5Gkf1vUc4.body: That error message seems to say: "The optional file that has a size of about 2.5 GB cannot be published because it's too large. Only files up to 1 GB can be included." Does that relate to your problem at all?

1598036610_14g2gXnsZdEPShFJkGdh5W3eGXmKz.body: using facebook your role is to enjoy the banner at the top. learn to enjoy the banner and also the continual rape.

1598171709_19dzDaMFcuCusp4anMUPkVc8zRzLJ.body:
Duckduckgo and startpage do not seem trustworthy at this point. 

The searx.me instance on https://search.fuckoffgoogle.net based in germany actually provides usable results. This of course could be a red flag in itself.

> [bigbadbob](#comment_1123_1CLhLYdMKjXtium9yjuRkSnFvPfdoUTXAj): Good luck with that.  I would be pretty confident saying google has ya by the nuts even if you are offline.

I don't think this is necessarily true. Why do you think, that would be the case?

> [bromium](#comment_1_1NHvwu73PZVXUgVbovvMjbBQWye4FabzH6): that site uses proxy to google search for you so of course it will have good results

What is your point?

1599385493_1Q2noE3qu7ccvEspqWWv4xkMktiqp.body: YACY seems pretty cool though. Crawling an open directory right now. It's a shame you have to manually configure your router, in order to contribute to the network. That's not ever going to happen, for me.

As a layman, here's my verdict:  The cpu consumption during crawling is too much! Seems a little presumptious for a piece of software to be that aggressive. Could be a bug of course. Guess I'll have another look in a year or two.

On a related note, a pretty great searx instance here: https://search.fuckoffgoogle.net/

1606080511_134skDNbvpgm7WpAjiJzbc6dQEfBa.body:
"Privacy is not just a personal preference. It’s not just a social necessity either. It’s a biological necessity as basic as breathing. It allows us all to be human. It is the right to be imperfect. Therefore, it must be protected. There is no point in asking if it’s too late to stop mass surveillance because there’s no alternative to curtailing it. It must be stopped."

http://127.0.0.1:43110/1NL5Z4ooMiEjrzN1n8cyKbbptqU8QTyZbe/raising-the-bar-on-privacy/

1606253317_1H9ZCecP2nbVicgXB77yqodz2xp4C.body:
I'm using this searx instance https://search.fuckoffgoogle.net. Works fine. Haven't visited any of the sites you mention for a long while and didn't miss them.

(It's still google/bing/ddg by proxy but what are you gonna do. Everything is shit.)

> [tttaevas](#comment_6_18sLokZGvmEqsoVbj8LJkM8NkwJxfUJX3G): Should you really care about a search engine's privacy policy..

In my opinion you should definitely care. A bad privacy policy indicates a lapse in judgment that has to permeate anything the company is and does. You know it's just a matter of time before their fuckery will make them unusable - so why touch it in the first place if you can avoid it?

1. My searx result are great! You must be using a bad instance. I do find wikipedia rather useful, so maybe you have different expectations than I do. Maybe look into YaCy? You can do a crawl that caters to your needs.

2. It should be easy enough for you to find out if google are sending garbage results or not: Make some queries on either engine and compare. Although I can't really see why it would matter either way.

> [sword000000](#comment_35_114FPBgGTFgsfrHMvQYkJ3aAR8zSmbyjie):  wikipedia [...]

I'm probably going to wikipedia to look up a movie or a band. I don't care about north american "political" punditry AT ALL. But that doesn't matter. What I really want to emphasize is:

Don't use https://searx.be. It sucks. Use https://search.fuckoffgoogle.net/ instead. (OR if you want unbiased results, manage your own crawl).

Service announcement: fuckoffgoogle.net is having issues at the moment. [Privacy tools search](https://search.privacytools.io/searx/) seems to work quite well though. 

(Don't use duckduckgo).
Startpage is an american ad company now and has been for a while. Might as well use google.

1607300234_1CLhLYdMKjXtium9yjuRkSnFvPfdo.body:
The spyware watchdog rates dissenter as "Low Tier — Poor Privacy", on par with brave and firefox. It comes pre-installed with an extension that "phones home to several places whenever you open it, including Google and Twitter". Default search engine is duckduckgo. No thanks.

http://127.0.0.1:43110/148LhjPS5mgRCoqQ9jshd8sK4A6jqQVV8r/articles/dissenter.html

1610760100_1QvU5RXqw5mjgR3BZV5rkc2ju6NHX.body: I'm curious about what this portends for the second amendment. If anything.

> [baduser](#comment_12_1KTDVd4rtqErz3FcxPx2nTmr4CSR9Q7hcr): BY EWAN PALMER ON 8/4/18 AT 9:15 AM EDT [...]

Well spotted. Shame on me. 
It's still a thing though. From nra's [own](https://www.nraforward.org) [website](https://home.nra.org/).

> [mfs](#comment_90_1B8Nj3YZQSgw2aqhrHof5w73RpP6Xk2a7W): This tagline is incorrect and the article is liberal propaganda.> baduser: BY EWAN PALMER ON 8/4/18 AT 9:15 AM EDT [...] [...]

Are you implying, I have an agenda to push? If so, you're wrong. 

>[cxvxvcxcv](> [cxvxvcxcv](#comment_2_1789pQPut6Qwi5VL6aCtpWCMbqaMHgdoZp): They are declaring bankruptcy to liquidate their assets without New York taking it all.  They are moving their HQ to Texas.  It's an asset protection measure.  It's what you do in totalitarian regimes.  You burn it down and run.  Even though I am an Endowment Member, I am no fan of their conduct for the last decade.  They've done nothing to protect the second amendment but pretend the slope isn't slippery.  GOA and the Virginia Citizens Defense League are much better organizations.  You step on a hair of their dick, and they sue the fuck out of you.

Thank you for clarifying. It makes sense.

1610999130_1J46C7eJx1gagCBw898jtb8n3RCWp.body: I don't know.. is it a friendly, supportive community?

1609170561_1QvU5RXqw5mjgR3BZV5rkc2ju6NHX.body: Bump. A month has passed. If you think John Peel and the Peel Sessions are awesome, please consider hosting a file or two.

Another month passed. Here's third and final reminder that John Peel showcased some great acts spanning almost four decades. Why not listen to a couple? [A flock of seaguls perhaps](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1DA3AYUWNqpwHGHtgTfUXF41JivZHte2af/A%20Flock%20of%20Seagulls%20-%20Peel%20Session%201981-7ND_HjB7c0I.mp4). [Nick Cave and The Cavemen from 1984](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1DA3AYUWNqpwHGHtgTfUXF41JivZHte2af/Nick%20Cave%20&%20The%20Cavemen%20-%20Peel%20Session%201984-aLd8u-QuYZ8.mp4). [Queen from 1973](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1DA3AYUWNqpwHGHtgTfUXF41JivZHte2af/Queen%20-%20Peel%20Session%201973-fP-xqI7Jwlo.mp4). These are famous bands of course. You could check out something you haven't heard already. Like .. "Kitchens of Distinction"? "Inspiral Carpets"??

Half Man Half Biscuit.

1613068421_1Knfo3Xr91jYnAA1idYY9Ce8TDk41.body:
Unless they actively delete the file, they will seed it for a while at least. It's possible to pin a file in order to seed indefinitely. You will most likely need to seed everything yourself always and forever or it will disappear.

You site is requesting 500 mb of storage on first load. Did you set up optional files correctly? 500 mb is way too much.

You have 312MB of "other" filetypes in your site, probably the epubs. 

Somewhere in [content.json](http://127.0.0.1:43110/15WekZHWESPLaShVxyPYUBnxt4MBvuHyyT/content.json) there should be a line that says "optional".

I'd try setting that to  something like
"optional": ".*\\.(mp4|mp3|jpg|zip|png|epub)",

You'll need to go to your site and press the "sign" button afterwards.

(Disclaimer: I know nothing. This may or may not work.)
I have a request. Neon Joe, seasons 1 and 2. Preferably 720p.

1613258600_1NZftAz9VSawGF5JgMYGFv4ByoKEa.body: I feel like Heinlein and Asimov had some of that optimism. A sense of excitement and adventure. Have space suit - will travel!

1615534190_13rk7ENn3AgdqRXgeGQozHD5TGQQC.body:
> [calmdownholden](#comment_26_17acbn9sNyYyLJrLfSz3KJxqonKZtgVxCD): Move your cursor to their comment. [...]

This is the easy way. If the entity you want to block has not made a comment, you can visit [zeroid](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1iD5ZQJMNXu43w1qLB8sfdHVKppVMduGz/). Search for the username and mute them there.

1615562753_165aBifCkjbWxo7rEf9ZaiCv39Npi.body: I like the [format](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1HHZVBPikyCaPZ69P1QgYbT3UpKa6jvLFV/od/od_3-12-2021.txt). Just text. Short and to the point.

1615672324_16LErDGxiEQgmerLmwT2sBrtBeg2P.body: Imported clearnet site with miner attached. Shit tier.

> [papull](#comment_40_1Nz5xXKiiTFGd6big5zcBnaGVH3hUUYv4G): no good games in the zite

This is a guy trying to steal cycles from your cpu. It is a malicious zite. A scam attempt. An attack on any visitor.

So why would you discuss the *quality of the games*? Did you actually run an executable brought to you by this malicious actor?

1616038647_1HMFDQQotv4JP5vv1XAsP7AR2Wwkg.body: Another low effort cloudminer attack. Shit tier.

1616114475_1NKkmuj4vzTYCuCD8ExJokgpcgyai.body: Cloudminer is a domain from where a script is pulled if you visit the above zite. My assumption is that the script will have your cpu and/or gpu mine some coin on behalf of op. [Edit](http://127.0.0.1:43110/Talk.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Topic:1615507108_1LJx7UWxfu1L7KZeNxdggqQqewk2CwEXWG).

1616209212_1M1U9ZvF9XJmt4oPY4TLBWHJZWDdR.body: Also, you have to maintain your own feed. A couple of well placed mutes will probably help.

> [202103](#comment_1_1CQzPmMXnfH3eJvpKGNfsVnUXxiHZM3jp2): This platform is dead. Lol.

Case in point. Goodbye "202103".
If you're having trouble muting someone, because the userid doesn't exist, probably your local copy of zeroid is not updated. Update zeroid and you should be able to mute the user after.
People with unorthodox views are not really a problem though. Spammers are.

1619276832_1MHt7kHieXeogoLntiLkqeBh1uVh9.body: The software still works but it's unmaintained and in decline. The userbase you knew have jumped ship. There used to be many nazis here - they have been replaced with what appears to be chinese gibberish bots. Good luck.

> [mozez](#comment_2_13ui1ziWUVZb7giGNYpAzHzdfCirkobc8x): What's the new stuff they use now? Back to .onion?

I have no idea. My statement was probably a little too assertive. I'm just lamenting the point that a lot of actual people seem to have stopped posting, while very few new participants, not counting the barrage of sockpuppets, seem to stay. Hopefully a fork will happen at some point.

1620774403_1QvU5RXqw5mjgR3BZV5rkc2ju6NHX.body:
[Mitch Hedberg](/19i7hXiRRz5vRqHmrUELKjzRofGPpAiFRv/Mitch%20Hedberg%20-%20Escalator%20can%20never%20brake%20joke-yHopAo_Ohy0.mp4)

I like an escalator, because an escalator can never break. It can only become stairs. There would never be an "Escalator temporarily out of order" sign. Only "Escalator, temporarily stairs".

1617087999_16u7ApvQbcH9sGVJV5ELBvY1AQiZL.body:
> [theofflinebay](#comment_8_16u7ApvQbcH9sGVJV5ELBvY1AQiZLnbDKN): webseed

What exactly is 'webseed' and why is relying on it a problem? Do you have suggestions for alternative ways of maintaining anonymity if you decide to stop supporting tor?

> [styromaniac](#comment_3100_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRFtVBhd): 
> [theofflinebay](#comment_11_16u7ApvQbcH9sGVJV5ELBvY1AQiZLnbDKN): 

Thanks. Another noob question - how to download the offline version? It's seems like the answer to this question should be obvious, but I can't figure it out for some reason.

> [theofflinebay](#comment_13_16u7ApvQbcH9sGVJV5ELBvY1AQiZLnbDKN): On theofflinebay.org go on the 'Search' page (next to 'About Us') and it has a torrent link there to download the offline version.  

Thanks! I suppose the dynamic information shown on search results such as age, seeds, leeches, etc. is still fetched 'online'?

> [j4s0f](#comment_2_172SzEe2eDN1U4swCbnPUbbGjoN9MXMnGQ): https://torlook.info is still better

Perhaps - if you don't mind loading external resources from four third party domains, among those google and cloudflare.

1622480057_1PSeiYvqdseW3aoqEV5gddDRr7gCH.body: Good idea. Tried it, works well. I wish the default settings were set to emphasize privacy. But I guess that could create a barrier for new users.

1623187560_1ANYVddodYd49XHwTsa391i8ig38V.body: I think [this](/1FfA8CzMxxmxCqrsMh39CNZbT1qWWaXRrB/) is a nice resource for people who are curious about suicide one way or another. Don't know about noleafclover1994.

1623520940_1GJc2vm4vJjAKsFoFJ2D3gGmKiRac.body:
[nicksphere](/1NL5Z4ooMiEjrzN1n8cyKbbptqU8QTyZbe/).
[mayvaneday](/1MeeJWbbQHArbqD6UUHSjh9EVycvnTUBFa/) 
[ansho rei](/13T79X7tG8Fi3EZCev3xU1wYTtFHHnqWGQ/). 

All updated in june. Not aware on any others.

> [fethearon](#comment_2_1CQm69MFcNZ4Wbn68mgy5f65JjZ6Ca1LUB): I'm very new to ZeroNet, is there a way to check or do you need to know the address to know?

There are some search engines, but they're a bit of a mixed bag in my experience. I guess you just have to start looking. [Here's](/18QPAtqyoxriNcNAi4mkCHyoLENwTEbFyw/) one resource - there are probably many others.

Note: You have to curate your own experience on zeronet. If you wish to mute someone, one way to do it is by searching for their username [here](/1iD5ZQJMNXu43w1qLB8sfdHVKppVMduGz/). Personally, I mostly use this feature to get rid of CP and spammers. Some like enabling [moab](/moab.zn/) - but currently it's really not much of a hassle to maintain your own list.

> [kapec](#comment_103_1CQ14MAUEp55ijU6rQLQ9vZdzxCQe9s1SF): Check this guy building a cabin.127.0.0.1:43110/1H8hYdFAtHikXWa617JbxDZoyoc6RJpWHY/

1625081391_1GJc2vm4vJjAKsFoFJ2D3gGmKiRac.body:
It's 'normal' to pick the most obvious available path. Until the clearnet walled gardens become obviously inconvenient for the many, no amount of content can attract 'the normal people' to a tiny unknown corner of a tiny unknown protocol.

I like the [All-Night Bookstore and Cafe](/13gLfTixjjktySEGHBMnmrQu4qMJpoRuXw) though and will attempt to support it with my presence. I hope some of the current zeronet users will do the same.

1628996725_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRF.body:
I got my mother-in-law an entry level Samsung, about $200. She's very happy with it. Infatuated even.

I know a scuba diver who recently picked up an newer iphone from the bottom of the habour. It was still on after having been submerged for more than 24 hours. Waterproof *and* decent battery life.

(The correct option imo is to get a cheap af 2017 nokia 3310. It has bluetooth, rudimentary internet, capacity for 64gb  sdcard, awesome battery life, shitty but functional camera and many other features. A great tool that doesn't try eat your brain. *I realise this is not going to happen*.)

1630241491_1GJc2vm4vJjAKsFoFJ2D3gGmKiRac.body: I suspect the answer to your question is: "Yes, there is more to islam than being a bully". I've never heard a muslim in the real world state or imply that the koran teached them to hate and kill non-muslims.

> [xcape2net](#comment_934_1GJc2vm4vJjAKsFoFJ2D3gGmKiRac2kfnz): .. They aren't the ones I'm asking the question about.

Well, I've never met any of the ones you're talking about, so do they really exist? For me they don't.

But let's assume that there are angry, violent people in the world. Maybe there are reasons for the anger that doesn't hinge on religion. Maybe the religion part is mainly an efficient mechanism to stay focused, united and unafraid in an impossible situation.

As we all know, bad memories stick way better than than the good ones. You speak of centuries of conflict. Maybe you belong to ascendants of a "winning" group. Maybe the collective memory of the losing group has a longer lifespan than that of the winning group. Maybe it's not fanatism on their part but amnesia on yours.

Except of cause for the very first thing, nothing comes from nothing. Everything moves because that behind it pushes, because that behind it pushes and so on. 

That's the true meaning of "everything happens for a reason". "Everything happens for a reason" is often interpreted as "Everything has purpose". But that's not true at all. The correct way of thinking about it is: "It happens because that before caused it to happen". This chain of events cannot be stopped. It can't be interfered with. Any interference would be part of the inescapable chain.

So if there are muslim bullies, they're there for a reason. Same goes for this conversation, I suppose.

1630778195_1GJc2vm4vJjAKsFoFJ2D3gGmKiRac.body: To the best of my knowledge, no one has been kicked off zeronet ever, not could they be. Wouldn't that suggest that free speech is doing fine here?

> [xcape2net](#comment_958_1GJc2vm4vJjAKsFoFJ2D3gGmKiRac2kfnz): I'm not saying free speech on ZeroNet is in danger.  I'm just thinking that maybe we could improve it. 
Everyone can already post whatever they want. I don't know how that can be improved.

> [xcape2net](#comment_958_1GJc2vm4vJjAKsFoFJ2D3gGmKiRac2kfnz): .. we don't talk very much about it.  
Some times "raising awareness" is not a good thing.

> [xcape2net](#comment_958_1GJc2vm4vJjAKsFoFJ2D3gGmKiRac2kfnz): .. when we talk about adding moderation
Who's talking about adding moderation? Please provide examples.

> [xcape2net](#comment_959_1GJc2vm4vJjAKsFoFJ2D3gGmKiRac2kfnz): the child pornographers have created their own sites, because the rest of us have apparently driven them off of ZeroTalk. 
No pedophiles were ever driven off of ZeroTalk. They can still post all they want, no? Same goes for bots, schizos, terrists, prophets, glowies.

>[xcape2net](#comment_963_1GJc2vm4vJjAKsFoFJ2D3gGmKiRac2kfnz): nuanced.

Fair enough. The most substantial thread on the topic seems to be [Should user-level moderation be implemented in ZeroTalk engine?](/Talk.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Topic:1597847864_15HwpjShZKp2dpMuZqFaariQtJvMawYLVq) (It already is). My views more or less mirror those of thorburns:

Individual user-blocking capabilities are necessary. Forum owner user-blocking capabilities are necessary. Because cp, spam, etc.

Anyway, last post for me on ZeroTalk. No more space, can't create new ID. See you elsewhere!
